Oh God, help me.

Slowly, images begin to emerge out of the blackness. It t a moment to realize that they are scenes from Sam's funer The CAMERA TRACKS along rows of mourners as seen from SAM P.O.V. He seems to be floating among them. We hear snippe of conversations. It all seems strangely odd and disjoint Time seems unfixed, malleable. We see a MINISTER standing beside the grave.
As we say farewell to our friend Sam  Wheat, we are reminded of his  kindness, his generosity, his buoyancy  of spirit...
The CAMERA KEEPS MOVING. Sam's associates from the bank a among the mourners.

(continuing) All that we treasure, our friends,  our loved ones, our body, our mind,  are but on loan to us. We must  surrender them all. We are all  travelers on the same road which  leads to the same end.

Sam notices a WOMAN in a fancy print dress comforting one the mourners. The woman looks up at him, smiles, and wave Sam is surprised. He looks behind him, but no one is ther As he turns back, the woman is walking away. She appears  just like any normal person until she approaches a large  gravestone and passes right through it. Sam is shocked.
As our loved one enters eternal life,  let us remember that love, too, is  eternal, that although we will miss  him, our love will light the void  and dispel the darkness.
Suddenly, Molly ENTERS THE FRAME. Sam spots her. The CAME STOPS.
Molly.

She does not respond. RUTH, her sister, leans over to her Tears form in Molly's eyes. A hand reaches out to give he tissue. Molly looks up. It is Carl. She gives him her han He squeezes it with affection.
...and into Your hands we commend  his spirit. May he rest in peace. In  the name of the Father, the Son, and  the Holy Ghost. Amen.

The casket is lowered into the ground. Molly approaches t grave. She us a little unsteady. Carl takes her elbow. A  shovel is placed in her hands. With great emotional effor she lifts a shovelful of dirt and tosses it onto the cask It lands with a REVERBERATING finality. Sam shudders.
leaving the cemetery. We hear them talking.
What time you going back to work?...  What's the buzz on Digital? It's  sad. He was so young... How's your  new Honda?... Going away this weekend?

desperately alone. Down the hill, people are getting back into their cars. Sam can see Molly being let into a limou He stands there staring at his own casket, grieving. Then after a moment, he turns away. Separating from his body,  from his own grave site, he runs after her.

Molly is sitting on the couch in the middle of the loft  surrounded by FRIENDS and WELL WISHERS. A young GIRL, her niece, cuddles in her lap. People are eating and milling  around. Slowly THE CAMERA BEGINS TO PAN. It ends on Sam,  standing alone in a corner. In the midst of all the activ he is lost and alone.

Raw clay on a potter's wheel spins hypnotically, sensuous Molly's wet hands press in, shaping it, molding it. A bow begins to appear. The camera pulls back and reveals Sam. is sitting on the floor behind her, knees pressed to his  chest, rocking aimlessly. Molly looks away from the bowl she is forming. It distort and bends. Angry, she digs her finger into it. The bowl  disintegrates. Tears form in her eyes. Frank jumps up on the bench beside her. Molly stares sadl around the room. Quietly, she begins talking to herself, the air.
Oh God, Sam...
Sam looks up.
(continuing) I picked up your shirts this morning.  I don't know why. Mr. Reynolds said  to tell you hello. I broke into tears.  It's so hard...
Sam walks over to Molly. Desperate for contact, he reache out to touch her cheek, but then hesitates and pulls back
(continuing) I think about you every minute. It's  like you're still here, like I can  feel you, Sam.
He stares at her, hoping, wondering.
I am here, Moll. I am.

Suddenly, as if hearing Sam's voice, the cat begins to hi Molly spins around. The cat scans the room. Unexpectedly, Sam's and the cat's eyes meet... With a wild SCREECH, the cat jumps from the bench and takes off running. Sam recoi Molly stands up.
Frank, what's wrong? Frank?
The cat is nowhere to be seen. All of a sudden, Molly fre Sam is standing right beside her. It is almost as though senses his presence.
(continuing; whispering) Sam?

She holds very still for a moment. Sam watches breathless loving her, wanting her. Then quietly, hopefully, he reac out. It is a useless gesture. In a moment of great poigna Molly shakes her head and walks right through him. He rem IN THE FRAME, alone.
Sam, stands in the corner of a large, walk-in closet, wat as Molly goes through his effects. Boxes, scattered under are filling up with his life's possessions. Molly reaches for a shirt.
Wait, Moll. Not that one. That's my  favorite...

She tosses it into a box and then takes down a sweater. I is obviously handmade, about four sizes too big. Sam  recognizes it. Molly holds the sweater tenderly and presses it to her ch After a moment she puts it back. Then, in a surprising  outburst, she cries out and begins flailing at the shelve Everything comes flying off. Sam reaches out to console h
(continuing) Molly, don't.
Unexpectedly, Carl comes rushing into the room. He takes  hold of Molly and sits her on the bed.
(continuing) Say something. Help her, Carl.
It's hard. It's very hard.
(sarcastic) Oh good. That's really good.

Molly and Carl are standing over the kitchen table foldin piles of Sam's clothes and placing them into boxes. As Mo lifts one of Sam's jackets, something falls from a side  pocket. It is his small black leather address book. Sam s at it with recognition. Carl sees the book fall and stoop to pick it up but Molly gets it first.
Sam's address book.

She skims through it a moment, but the memories it evokes are too powerful for her. She places it carefully into a labeled "Sam's Things -- Valuable" and continues packing. She finds the old jar with the penny in it. It's marked " Luck". She holds it tenderly for a moment and then places on the nightstand beside the bed. Carl discovers some old ticket stubs in another of Sam's  jackets. He examines them.
Dave Brubeck. Newport '86. Should I  toss 'em?
No!
Molly, we hated that concert.
She takes the stubs and lovingly puts them in the box. Sa groans. Carl finds a half used package of Rolaids. Molly takes th from his hand and puts them in the box, too.
Oh, you want to save those?
Rolaids? What are you doin' Moll?
Molly just stares for a moment.
I miss him, Carl.
Carl comes over and takes her hand.
We all do.
Molly buries her head on his shoulder. Carl strokes her h
Carl lifting a pile of boxes and carrying them to the doo Suddenly Molly yells out.
Wait. Wait. Not that one.
She hurries over and pulls the "Valuable" box from the st in his arms. He looks at it with surprise.
Oh, shit. I'm sorry. I don't know  how that got in there.
He turns to the door and then back to Molly.
(continuing) Hey, Moll. Why don't you come? It's  like summer outside.
No.
Just for a stroll. It'd be good to  get out.
Molly shakes her head and turns away.
I can't do it Carl.
Carl, annoyed, walks over to her.
Molly... you're not the one who died!
Molly stops and looks at him. He has struck home. After a moment she nods her head.
Okay. Just a short walk.
He gently squeezes her shoulders.
Thata girl.
Before Sam even understands what is happening, they are  exiting the loft. Sam jumps up and runs after them.
Hey, Molly! Wait!

The door slams shut. Sam is locked inside. Frightened and desperate, he rushes for the door knob. His hand sinks th it. There is a strange sound, like ELECTRICAL STATIC, as penetrates the metal and wood. Frightened, he yanks it ba Sam circles the space several times and then returns to t door. Clenching his teeth, he reaches out again. As his h pushes up against it, we sense that he experiences a subt resistance. The hairs on the back of his hand vibrate as ghostly form presses into it. We sense Sam's fear as his  entire arm DISAPPEARS FROM VIEW. The grating ELECTRICAL S shudders up his spine. The sight of his amputated limb is unsettling but Sam doe not pull back. Slowly he edges in and presses his face in the molecules of the wood.
as atoms and electrons spin past him at frightening speed There is a sense of a universe in total chaos. Terrifying SOUNDS charge through his body.
pulling back from the door. He is trembling.

head_text.subj: THE CAMERA MOVES SLOWLY THROUGH THE LOFT AND GRADUALLY

text: DISCOVERS SAM. He is sitting in a corner singing quietly himself.
"Singing bye bye, Miss American Pie.  Drove my Chevy to the levy, but the  levy was dry. Them good ol' boys  were drinkin' whiskey and rye, and  singing this'll be the day that I..."

He stops, realizing the last word of the song. He sits  silently, staring at the wall. Suddenly, there is a SOUND at the door. Sam's eyes shoot The door begins to open. Sam stands up. His face begins to tighten. We know instan that something is wrong. His eyes fill with a fury we hav not seen before. The Mugger, the man who killed Sam, is entering the loft. has a key in his hand and puts it in his pocket. Sam is  stunned. The Mugger locks the door.
Sam goes wild. He shoots at the man with all his might,  attacking him unceasingly, but with no effect. His hands feet pass right through him.
You motherfucking bastard! What the  hell are you doing here? What are  you doing?
The Mugger, unaware that anything is going on, glances ar nervously as he moves through the vast space.

Entering the bedroom, the Mugger goes to the dresser and  quickly examines the drawers. He is very neat, careful to leave no sign that he was there. He seems to be looking f something but cannot find it.

Suddenly we hear a KEY TURNING in the front door. The Mug seems startled. He dashes from the bedroom and hides quic behind one of the large sculptures. We hear the door OPEN Molly is standing there. Sam goes crazy.
Molly, no! Get out!

Molly closes the door and locks it shut. Sam freezes as s heads for the bedroom. She walks right past the Mugger. T Sam's horror she stops and turns to look around. There is curious expression on her face. Seeing nothing she contin through the loft. The Mugger pulls out his gun. Sam looks on in absolute te Molly's purple blouse hits the floor as she begins to rem her clothes. She turns on the radio. Sam doesn't know what to do. The Mugger seems excited by  Molly's semi-nudity. He begins skirting the edges of the  loft, moving toward the bedroom. Sam is crazed. Suddenly, out of nowhere, Frank appears at the Mugger's f Sam's eyes light up. He drops to his knees, crawls over t him, glares into his eyes, and screams.

SCREECHES and jumps straight up. His claws shoot out at t mugger's face, ripping into the flesh near his eye. Blood appears. The mugger sees it dripping through his  fingers. The sight of it upsets him. He grabs the cat ang by the neck. It SQUEALS. Molly in her bra, peers from the bedroom.
Frank, what's wrong?

The Mugger holds the cat's mouth shut. Seeing and hearing nothing, Molly steps back into the bedroom. The Mugger takes the cat and throws it across the floor.  Holding his eye, he gets up and rushes for the exit. Sam  runs after him, but the door closes before he can get thr He is left inside.

stares at the closed door in a wild panic. He doesn't kno what to do. Then, summoning all of his courage, he takes blind, running slow motion leap and charges through it. SAM'S P.O.V. There is a brief sense of passing through a molecular for field, a miniature universe inside the door.
as he emerges from the door and lands on the other side. seems excited to have survived and is very pleased with  himself.

The Mugger steps out onto the sidewalk and hurries toward the subway. A patch of sleeve soaks up the blood from his eye. Sam starts after the man but instantly freezes. Hordes of people crowd the sidewalk. The crush of humanity is  frightening. Two lovers, holding hands, are coming right him. Before Sam is able to move, we hear the sound of the arms cutting through his ghostly form. Sam tries instinctively to dodge the crowds but people  approach him from all angles. We hear a BABY CARRIAGE roll through Sam's feet and he ne falls over trying to avoid it. His instincts will not let go. A barrage of images and SOUNDS assaults Sam. It is more t he can handle. Still, he refuses to give up. He stays clo to the Mugger.
The Mugger heads down a flight of steps into the IRT.

The Mugger gets onto a crowded subway car. Sam stands nea corner of the train watching him. Suddenly, Sam notices that something odd is happening. On of the riders at the other end of the car is walking towa him. As he approaches the Mugger, he does not stop, but p right through him. It takes Sam a moment to realize what happening, but then it is too late.

With unholy fury the New Ghost charges into Sam. The atta is so unexpected and ferocious that Sam has no sense of h to defend himself. With unexpected power, the Ghost grabs hold of him and slams him into the subway door. Sam's hea plows right through it.
on Sam's head sticking outside of the car as the subway t rushes past him. There is a panicked look on his face. Th look intensifies as he turns and sees another train barre down on him.

on Sam's body inside the car still struggling with the Gh as the other train shoots by the window. With a huge gasp Sam shoots back into the car, and wrests himself free of Ghost's hold. The Ghost flies after him, screeching. Sam surges through the door at the end of the train and f himself on the bridge between the subway cars. The subway Ghost stares at him through the window with a wild, insan look.
Stay off! This is mine!

With shocking impact, the Ghost's fist goes flying into t window. To Sam's terror and amazement, the window SHATTER The Ghost smiles. Passengers scream and Sam dives for cov Sam stares at the broken glass with fascination and confu Suddenly, the train moves from the darkness of the tunnel into broad daylight.
The train stops at an elevated subway platform in Brookly
Sam sees the Mugger exiting the train and frantically rus after him.
Sam follows the Mugger down a long covered staircase to t street.

The Mugger heads toward 321 Prospect Place. The streets a lined with old apartment buildings. Many windows are boar up. TWO MEN, standing on the corner, are slamming a piece heavy machinery onto the pavement. Sam hears GOSPEL MUSIC coming from a storefront church an notices a sign, "SISTER ODA MAE BROWN, MEDIUM, SPIRIT REA ADVISOR." He looks up to a third story window and sees a  similar sign with day-glo arrows pointing to the entrance the street. He seems curious, but then realizes that the  Mugger is nearly halfway down the block. He turns and rus after him.
Sam and the mugger approach a tenement building at 321  Prospect Place.
Sam follows the Mugger into the building and watches as h opens the mail box for APT. 4D. The name scribbled across is WILLIE LOPEZ. There's no mail.

Sam enters Willie's apartment. It is a squalid affair. Pe paint chips litter the floor. The bed is unmade. Willie pulls open a drawer in a small nightstand and drop in the keys to Molly's loft. Sam sees his wallet. His dri license, bank ID, and a photo of Molly are there, too.  Furious, Sam lunges for Willie but then holds his punch,  knowing it will have no effect. He turns instead to a win and, like the Ghost on the subway, smashes it with his fi Nothing happens.
Damn!
Willie dials the phone. Someone comes on the line.
She came home. I couldn't get it.  Give me a couple of days. I'll go  back.
He hangs up. Sam stares at him in wild confusion.
Get what? Who the hell are you? What  were you doing at Molly's? What the  hell's going on?

Willie grabs a bottle of wine from the nightstand and lie down. After a moment he reaches over and takes Molly's ph from the drawer. He studies it slowly. Sam stands by the door in a state of motionless rage. The is nothing he can do.
(continuing) Stay away from her!

Sam storms down the street. His movements seem undirected utterly aimless. He is seething inside. Suddenly Sam looks up. An old BAG LADY is walking down th street talking loudly to a SHORT WOMAN tagging along besi her. As they approach a street pole, the Bag Lady swerves the side. The Short Woman, however, walks right through i Passersby laugh at the Old Lady talking to herself. Sam,  unsettled, rushes away. As Sam rounds a corner, a sudden blast of MUSIC explodes of nowhere. Sam jumps into the street, gasping. A phonogr needle SCRATCHES across a record and the MUSIC STOPS. A  woman's voice booms out:
Sorry 'bout that.

to a pair of loudspeakers in a storefront window. The MUS blares out once more and SOUNDS of gospel fill the street Sam looks up. He is back in front of the storefront churc with the sign for SISTER ODA MAE BROWN, MEDIUM, SPIRIT RE ADVISOR, hanging overhead. Below it is another sign. "Con the dearly departed. $20.00". Sam stares at the sign with curiosity. The MUSIC is  compelling. After a moment's hesitation, he goes in the o door.

A record player is sitting near the storefront window, a  makeshift microphone placed in front of it. Several rows of folding chairs face a raised platform wit nothing on it. A number of people are sitting there, most women. One gets the sense that this is a cross between a  waiting room and a meeting hall. A black WOMAN steps up o the platform and calls out:
Rosa Santiago.
MRS. SANTIAGO tucks a Spanish paperback romance into her  purse and heads to a door at the rear of the hall. Sam fo after her.

Mrs. Santiago enters a dark room with a window and door  leading to a side street. A paisley bedspread is tacked o the window. In the center of the room is a round seance table. Two  heavyset sisters, CLARA (39), and LOUISE (36), are standi beside an open closet. It is empty.
Please be seated.
Mrs. Santiago sits at the table. She seems apprehensive.  Clara steps into the closet and taps on each of the walls though demonstrating that they are solid.
My sister will be with us soon.
She steps back out and closes the door. Louise inserts a  tape into a boom box and then steps forward.
Sister Oda Mae. Grant us the gift of  your all-seeing presence. Appear for  us now.

She turns back to the closet and opens the door. Like mag ODA MAE BROWN, 41, appears standing inside. She is a blac woman in a white tunic. The whiteness of her garment make it look as if she is glowing in the dark. Mrs. Santiago i wide-eyed. Sam smiles as Oda Mae steps into the room.
Mrs. Santiago.
Buenos dias.
She takes a twenty dollar bill from her purse and hands i to Oda Mae. Clara graciously intercepts the money.
I understand you are hoping to contact  your husband.
Si. Si.
Well, I believe he's gonna be with  us today.
Oh, tsank you, tsank you.
Tears well up in her eyes. She crosses herself several ti
But there's no telling about the  other world. You gotta cast out all  doubt. You gotta believe. Do you  believe?
(nodding her head  vigorously) Si. Si. I believe. I believe.

And remember, we don't make no  promises. I can phone up there till  I'm blue in the face, (she points to the  ceiling) ...but it don't necessarily mean  he's gonna be home. Them folks go  shopping, they play bingo. It's just  like here. You can't always get 'em.
Mrs. Santiago, utterly fascinated, nods understandingly.
Sure lady!
Oda Mae's eyes glance up curiously for a second, as thoug she heard something, and then she continues.
Okay, let's get ready then.

Sam steps back as the sisters get up and position themsel behind Oda Mae. The moment feels rehearsed, theatrical. O Mae raises her hands into the air and closes her eyes. Th is a hush in the room. Her body begins to tremble. Mrs.  Santiago clutches her chair. Suddenly Oda Mae breaks out her trance.
We got a problem here. I don't think  he's in. Wait. I feel something. Did  he know someone who's passed over,  someone named Anna... Mary...  Consuela... Maria?
Si, si! His mama. She's Maria.
Ah! I knew it. He's with his mama.
(sarcastic) Oh my God...
Oda Mae's eyes dart uncomfortably around the room.
I'm afraid this is gonna be too hard.  Now I got two souls I gotta contact.  I don't know about that. It's  difficult, you know. The pain. The  effort.
I pay more. How much? How much?
Twenty dollars.
Way to go. Milk her for every penny.

Oda Mae jumps up and stares at her sisters. They look bac at her curiously. They can't figure out what's wrong. Nei can Oda Mae. Mrs. Santiago reaches into her purse. A twenty dollar bil changes hands. Sam watches, amazed at it all. Oda Mae sit down and goes back into her trance. Her eyeballs roll up  into their sockets.
Praise the Lord. Thank you, Jesus.
Oda Mae is beginning to shake again. The two women grab h shoulders to keep her from falling out of the chair. Sudd her whole body stiffens.
(continuing) Have mercy! Have mercy!

Mrs. Santiago stares on in amazement. After a moment Oda  Mae's body collapses in a heap. Then, like a phoenix risi from the ashes, she pulls herself up in her chair and ass a normal pose. After several seconds to get her bearings, Oda Mae begins speak. Only now she has an entirely new voice. It sounds  deep and hoarse, like an old man's. For all its put on  theatricality, it is strangely convincing.
Welcome, Rosa Santiago. You are  fortunate today. The channel is clear.  Many spirits are gathering.
(scanning the room) Yeah? Where?
Oda Mae jerks. Her eyes dart nervously around the room.
My husband?
(a bit uneasy) I can feel his vibration. Yes, yes,  he is drawing toward us now. I can  see him coming.
Julio! Julio! How is he? How does he  look?
Oh, he is a very handsome man.
(surprised) Handsome?
In our Father's Kingdom we are all  handsome.
(understanding) Julio!
Sam looks on dismayed.
He is standing before me. He is  wearing a black suit.
A black suit? Oh yes, yes. He was  buried in that.
Mrs. Santiago begins to cry. Sam looks around the room wi growing disgust. Then he leans over to Oda Mae and yells  into her ear.
What a crock of shit!
Oda Mae nearly falls off her chair. She spins around.
Who's there?
Sam is stunned. Clara and Louise look at one another in t confusion. This is obviously not part of the act. Mrs.  Santiago seems frightened.
(continuing) Where are you?
(looking around) Who?
Oda Mae screams and jumps up thrashing at the air. Her kn kicks the table and sends it toppling. Mrs. Santiago is  terrified.
Julio! Julio!
What's going on?
Get out of here! Leave me alone!
Mrs. Santiago doesn't know what to do. She begins to cry.
Who are you talking to?
Clara runs up to Oda Mae.
Keep him away!
Louise looks at the empty room.
Are you talking to me?
Do something. Help me.
Clara just stares at her sister. Sam is excited and amaze
I don't believe this. Hey you. My  name is Sam Wheat. Can you hear me?  Sam Wheat!
Stop it!
Say my name! Sam Wheat! Say it!
Talk to me, Oda Mae. Say something.
Sam Wheat!
Sam nearly falls on his face. Clara's eyes widen. She is  more confused than ever.
Jesus!
Samweet?

Oda Mae runs into the closet. It has a false panel leading to a hidden chamber on the l side and she barricades herself inside it. Clara and Loui stand outside pulling on the handle. They seem frightened
Oda Mae! Oda Mae!
Oda Mae is rocking back and forth on the floor praying. S feet enter the frame beside her.
Lord, I swear, no more cheatin'. I  promise, Lord. I don't want to go to  hell. I'll do anything. Gimme a  penance. Just make him go away.
Go away. Hell no. I'm stayin' right  here!

Oda Mae screams, jumps back into the closet, and bolts up against the door. It tears from its hinges and falls into the seance room, nearly crushing Louise. Mrs. Santiago ru out screaming. Oda Mae takes one look around and collapse in a dead faint.

Beads of sweat collect on Oda Mae's brow and cheeks. She  seems feverish. Clara and Louise are sitting beside her w damp towels nervously soaking up the perspiration. Oda Ma appears to be talking to herself until we PULL BACK and r Sam nearby.

My mama, her mama, may they rest in  peace, they had de gift. Mama always  said I had it, but I never did. She  tol' me all about it, how it felt  an' all. But now that it's happenin'  I don't know what to do. You're  scarin' me half to death. Please,  you gotta go away, you gotta find  someone else.
Clara and Louise look at one another with growing concern
Someone else? Are you outta your  mind?
I'm gettin' there fast. (she pushes Louise's  hand) Leave me alone.
Not till you help me.
Where are you?
Where? I'm right here.
I'm standing right beside you.
(mimicking his words) "I'm standing right beside you." (she pauses and looks  up) Are you white?
What?
Oh God, I knew it. He's white. Why  me?
Louise looks at her sister and shakes her head.
Listen, damn it. You can help me.  There's a woman, Molly Jensen. She's  in terrible danger. The man who killed  me broke into our apartment. He's  going to go back. You've gotta warn  her.
Why would she listen to me?
She has to! This man's a killer!  He's got a key.
Forget it, mister. I can't.
It's just a phone call. You're all  I've got. Lookit. I'm not leavin'  till you help me. I don't sleep  anymore, so I can sit here day and  night. I don't care how long it takes.  I can talk forever.
Oda Mae gulps, a horrified expression on her face.
The telephone rings. Molly, preparing dinner, runs to ans it.
Hello.
Molly? Is this Molly speaking?
Yes.
My name is Oda Mae. I'm a spiritual  reader and adviser. (she hesitates) I'm calling for a friend of yours.  He asked me to call. This is  important. You gotta believe me.  Don't be afraid.
Who is this?
I got a message from Sam.
(stunned) What?
Sam Wheat. He asked me to call.
Molly slams down the receiver, panting. For several secon she doesn't move. Slowly, she walks to the couch and sits down. She is trembling.
Oda Mae hangs up the phone.
What'd I tell you.
You gotta go there.
Look, I don't care what you do to  me, I'm not goin' nowhere.
Sam is sitting on the edge of Oda Mae's bed, singing. It  sounds like he's been singing for hours. He is very hoars

"I'm Henery the Eighth I am / Henery  the Eighth I am, I am / I'm gettin'  married to the widow next door /  She's been married seven times before  / And every one was an Henery /  Wouldn't take a Willie or a Sam /  I'm her eighth old man I'm Henery /  Henery the Eighth I am, I am / Henery  the Eighth I am / Second verse same  as the first / I'm Henery the Eighth  I am..."
Oda Mae bolts upright in her bed, her hands over her ears
Okay! Okay! I'll go. You just shut  your mouth.
Sam and Oda Mae are sitting at the rear of a crowded bus. She appears to be talking to herself.
I can't believe I'm doin' this. I  gotta be a crazy lady goin' into the  city with you. I never go there.  What the hell you doin' in my life,  huh? Why me?
Several people move away.
Oda Mae approaches the loft building and buzzes Molly's  apartment. She waits a few moments.
There's nobody there.
Just wait.
No, sir. I did what I promised. I  said I'd come and I'm here. I didn't  say anything 'bout waitin'.
Just one more time. Please. It's a  big place.
Oda Mae turns to leave. Sam, desperate, starts to sing.
(continuing) "Ninety-nine bottles of beer on the  wall, ninety nine bottles of beer,"
Oda Mae stops. She turns back to the buzzer and rings onc more. Suddenly Molly answers.
Hello, who's there?
(nervous) Don't go away. It's Oda Mae Brown. I  called you last night. Your friend  Sam says you gotta talk to me.
There is a CLICK as Molly hangs up.
Molly walks away from the intercom, shaken. Suddenly we h Oda Mae yelling up from the street.
Hey you, Molly! You gotta listen to  me! this is for real. Sam is here.  He needs to talk to you.
Molly walks over to the window and looks down. Oda Mae is standing in the street looking up. She is calling out at top of her lungs. Molly pulls back. She is afraid.

(continuing) He says remember the starfish at  Montego Bay? Remember the picture he  took a' you in Reno? (pause) Remember his green underwear, the  pair you wrote your name on? She  wrote her name on 'em?
Molly tenses. There is a sign of recognition in her eyes.
Oda Mae is standing by the curb and shouting up to Molly' fifth floor window. Several people stare at her curiously She turns to them.
Hey, do you mind? This here's a  private conversation.
The people turn away. She turns back to the window. Sam  prompts her.
Ask her about the sweater in the  closet, the one she knitted that's  too big.
What about the sweater you knitted  that was too big?
Four sizes.
Four sizes.
She couldn't throw it out. I saw. I  was there.
You couldn't throw it out. He saw.  He was there. This is for real. Hey  do you hear me up there?
A WORKMAN peers out of a second story window.
I hear you.
I'm not talkin' to you.
Haven't you ever heard of phones?
Kiss my behind! (yelling again) Listen, I'm not gonna stand here all  day.
